result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Joseph Corbine

records.addlTxt:
11:04 AM Defendant Brandon Joseph Corbine in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Brandon Joseph Corbine.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.   State recites agreement, All parties agree. (5 years prison.  2- 1/2 years initial confinement,  2-1/2 years Extended Supervision - STAYED.   3 years Probation:  Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.   Fine/Costs  $654)   Court reviews filed information and DEF enters NC Plea to Count 1.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty to Count 1.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.  Court orders long form PSI based on request of the DEF, and sets a sentencing hearing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on December 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:03 PM Defendant Brandon Joseph Corbine in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Brandon Joseph Corbine.   Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Chapman acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea to all counts.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty  Chapman indicate DEF waives prelim.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.

3:11 PM Defendant Brandon Joseph Corbine in court.  Attorney Daniel Chapman appears in court.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Court appointed Attny Chapman to case.   Court sets bond.  SIBS $5000.  Through Attny, DEF waives preliminary hearing.    DEF to report to jail for fingerprints.
Arraignment scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
